abstract: A bit mask that specifies both a part of an interface element to align and a direction for the alignment between two interface elements.

# NSLayoutConstraint.FormatOptions

**Structure**

A bit mask that specifies both a part of an interface element to align and a direction for the alignment between two interface elements.

## Declaration

```swift
struct FormatOptions
```

## Constants

- **alignAllLeft**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/left] on each.
- **alignAllRight**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/right] on each.
- **alignAllTop**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/top] on each.
- **alignAllBottom**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/bottom] on each.
- **alignAllLeading**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/leading] on each.
- **alignAllTrailing**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/trailing] on each.
- **alignAllCenterX**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/centerX] on each.
- **alignAllCenterY**: Align all specified interface elements using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Attribute/centerY] on each.
- **alignAllLastBaseline**: Align all specified interface elements using the last baseline of each one.
- **alignAllFirstBaseline**: Align all specified interface elements using the first baseline of each one.
- **alignmentMask**: Bit mask that can be combined with an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/FormatOptions] variable to yield only the alignment portion of the format options.
- **directionLeadingToTrailing**: Arrange objects in order based on the normal text flow for the current user interface language. In left-to-right languages (like English), this arrangement results in the first object being placed farthest to the left, the next one to its right, and so on. In right-to-left languages (like Arabic or Hebrew), the ordering is reversed.
- **directionLeftToRight**: Arrange objects in order from left to right.
- **directionRightToLeft**: Arrange objects in order from right to left.
- **directionMask**: A bit mask that can be combined with an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/FormatOptions] variable to yield only the direction portion of the format options.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a formatting-options structure with the specified raw value.

## Constants

- **NSLayoutConstraint.Relation**: The relation between the first attribute and the modified second attribute in a constraint.
- **NSLayoutConstraint.Attribute**: The part of the object’s visual representation that should be used to get the value for the constraint.
- **NSLayoutConstraint.Orientation**: The layout constraint orientation, either horizontal or vertical, that the constraint uses to enforce layout between objects.
- **NSEdgeInsets**: A description of the distance between the edges of two rectangles.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
